Philippine: The Birth of Kawi script, this Abugida are become widely used in the Maritime Southeast Asia, the word Kawi or Kawikaan means "Poetry" in Sanskrit.
Indonesia: The Sumatra-based Srivijaya naval kingdom flourishes and declines. (to 1500)
Wet-field rice cultivation, small towns and kingdoms flourish. Trade links are established with China and India.

Sojomerto inscription possibly dated around late 7th century discovered in Batang, Central Java, mentioned about Dapunta Selendra, possibly the ancestor of Sailendra dynasty. The inscription was written in old Malay suggested Srivijayan link to this family.
India: According to the Qissa-i Sanjan, the immigrants Parsi are granted permission to stay by the local ruler Jadi Rana
